p: The antimicrobial activities of the essential oils from the leaves of both A. schaueriana specimens were evaluated against C. albicans, A. brasiliensis, S. aureus, P. aeruginosa, and E. coli. The growth inhibitions obtained for both oils, at the highest dose tested (217 Âµg/mL), are presented in Table 3. P. aeruginosa was the most sensitive organism for both oils, presenting the highest growth inhibition.
